Package ohos.hiviewdfx

Class HiChecker

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.hiviewdfx.HiChecker

  • public class HiChecker
extends Object
    Represents the HiChecker tool that is used to detect bad code usage and execution results during your application and system development.

    You can use HiChecker to detect any file read/write or network access operation that is not supposed to take place on a specific thread, helping you fix the issue. For example, you can use HiChecker to catch file read/write on the UI thread, which should not involve such time-consuming operations. In addition, you can use HiChecker to detect process-specific resource leakage.

    Sample code for adding a rule and starting detection: 

     if (HICHECKER_ENABLED) {
     EnumSet<Rule> = EnumSet.of(Rule.CHECK_FILE_READ, Rule.CHECK_VM_RELEASE_MISS, Rule.CAUTION_BY_LOG);
     HiChecker.addRule(rules);
 }
    Since:
    5

    • Method Detail

      • addRule

        public static void addRule​(EnumSet<HiChecker.Rule> rules)
        Adds one or more rules for HiChecker.

        HiChecker detects unexpected operations or gives feedback based on the added rules.

        Parameters:
        rules - Indicates one or more rules you want to add. If this parameter is null, HiChecker will not perform detection or give feedback.
        Since:
        5
        See Also:
        HiChecker.Rule

      • addRule

        public static void addRule​(HiChecker.Rule rule)
        Adds a rule for HiChecker.

        HiChecker detects unexpected operations or gives feedback based on the added rule.

        Parameters:
        rule - Indicates the rule you want to add. If this parameter is null, HiChecker will not perform detection or give feedback.
        Since:
        5
        See Also:
        HiChecker.Rule

      • addDefaultRules

        public static void addDefaultRules​()
        Adds default rules to start detection.

        Available default rules cover all those specific to the current thread and process, and the caution rule (cautions just being logged, as defined by Rule.CAUTION_BY_LOG).

        Since:
        5
        See Also:
        HiChecker.Rule

      • addAllRules

        public static void addAllRules​()
        Adds all rules to start detection.

        Such rules cover all those specific to the current thread, process, and caution.

        Since:
        5
        See Also:
        HiChecker.Rule

      • removeRule

        public static void removeRule​(EnumSet<HiChecker.Rule> rules)
        Removes one or more rules. The removed rules will no longer take effect.
        Parameters:
        rules - Indicates one or more rules you want to remove.
        Since:
        5
        See Also:
        HiChecker.Rule

        public static void removeAllRules​()
        Removes all available rules.

      • getRule

        public static EnumSet<HiChecker.Rule> getRule​()
        Obtains all available rules.

        Such rules cover all those specific to the current thread, process, and caution.

        Returns:
        Returns the obtained rules.
        Since:
        5

      • contains

        public static boolean contains​(HiChecker.Rule rule)
        Checks whether a specified rule is included in the added rules.

        If the specified rule is thread-specific, this method only checks the current thread for that rule.

        Parameters:
        rule - Indicates the specified rule.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the specified rule is included; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        5
        See Also:
        HiChecker.Rule

      • removeCheckFileWriteRule

        public static EnumSet<HiChecker.Rule> removeCheckFileWriteRule​()
        Removes the rule of detecting file write operations.

        You can call this method when file write operations are regarded normal. After the removal, you can restore the rule if required.

        Returns:
        Returns the rules before removal.
        Since:
        5

      • removeCheckFileReadRule

        public static EnumSet<HiChecker.Rule> removeCheckFileReadRule​()
        Removes the rule of detecting file read operations.

        You can call this method when file read operations are regarded normal. After the removal, you can restore the rule if required.

        Returns:
        Returns the rules before removal.
        Since:
        5

      • notifySlowProcess

        public static void notifySlowProcess​(String tag)
        Notifies your application of a slow processing if the current code has invoked time-consuming operations.

        This notification helps your application avoid calling the current code in a key thread.

        Parameters:
        tag - Indicates the slow processing tag, which reflects information except for stack information.
        Since:
        5

      • setCautionListener

        public static void setCautionListener​(Executor executor,
                                      HiChecker.OnCautionListener listener)
        Sets a callback for caution handling.

        After a caution is generated, the preset rules (such as caution logging) are applied and the caution is passed via the callback to the application for caution handling.

        Parameters:
        executor - Indicates the provided Executor object, where the callback will be executed. If this parameter is null, a null pointer will be thrown.
        listener - Indicates the OnCautionListener object. If this parameter is null, a null pointer will be thrown.
        Since:
        5
        See Also:
        HiChecker.OnCautionListener
